author: Alex Johnson
content: Great article! I've been using PNG optimization for years, but learned some new techniques here. The metadata removal tip alone saved me 30% file size.

author: Maria Garcia
content:
Thanks for the comprehensive guide. Here's a quick script I use for batch PNG optimization:

```bash
for file in *.png; do
  optipng -o7 "$file"
  pngcrush -rem gAMA -rem cHRM -rem iCCP "$file" "optimized_$file"
done
```

This combines OptiPNG and PNGCrush for maximum compression.

author: Sarah Williams
content:
@Maria Garcia Thanks for sharing that script! I modified it slightly to preserve original files:

```bash
for file in *.png; do
  cp "$file" "backup_$file"
  optipng -o7 "$file"
done
```

Always good to keep backups when batch processing.
